job_description: Solution Architect - job post Violet Ink 1 W Illinois St, Chicago, IL 60654 From $70 an hour -  Contract Apply now Apply now save-icon Job details Salary From $70 an hour Job Type Contract Job Description: Required: · BS/BA Degree in Computer Science, business, or life science field. · 10+ years of experience as manufacturing solution architect role supporting and implementing large scale IT solutions including software deployment, business analysis, project management, process improvement and computer systems validation, including process manufacturing (OPM), integrations with manufacturing execution systems (MES), inventory management, warehouse management, product labelling creation and scanning, production planning and in process quality inspection. · Experience developing and supporting an integrated enterprise level ERP system, preferably Oracle EBS and MES. · Excellent verbal and communication skills, excellent interpersonal and negotiation skills. · Experience creating the framework for the operationalization of the support & sustainment activities, provided daily monitoring support for critical jobs and resolution to issues. · Experience coordinating the release of the different solutions to the Production environment, following the client’s Software Development Life Cycle (SDLC) processes, and ensuring all deliverables were met. · Demonstrated technical understanding of application architecture to include application servers, web servers, configuration files, relational databases, SQL and reporting applications. · Strong interpersonal and negotiation skills, with a high degree of self-motivation and ability to work independently. · MS-Office knowledge (Microsoft project, PowerPoint, Visio). Job Description · Serve as solution architect for Oracle EBS in support of Internal and external manufacturing (OPM and discrete), inventory management, manufacturing master data; as well as integrations with MES (Manufacturing Execution System) and other applications (Rapid Response, LIMS, etc.) to support the internal manufacturing processes. · Lead the efforts in managing, developing, and optimizing enterprise applications and improve manufacturing business processes to achieve corporate objectives. · Responsible for applying expertise and experience in Manufacturing, Supply Chain, Project Management and Enterprise Applications to solve existing business problems and drive business transformation. · Collaborate with project managers including developing detailed project timelines, communication, documentation, resource management and vendor management. · Participate in GxP validations/qualification of internal manufacturing systems including reviewing validation protocols. · Develop effective working relationships with internal customers and vendors. · Demonstrate a high level of professionalism and knowledge of IT solutions, applications management through product cycles and business environments. · Identify risk and mitigation plan in conjunction with the business and other IT partners. · Prioritizes activities and quickly adapt to changing situations. · Advises management on technical and process issues. · Maintains productive and positive interpersonal relationship with in IT Job Type: Contract Pay: From $70.00 per hour Schedule: 8 hour shift BHJOB15656_18565 - Network Architect - job post Myticas Consulting 11 reviews Chicago, IL Contract Apply now Apply now save-icon Job details Job Type Contract The recruitment team at Myticas Consulting is looking to hire a Network Architect responsible for the design and refinement of an enterprise-wide network ensuring we can meet our business objectives. The Network Architect will consult and collaborate cross-organizationally to support the delivery of end-to-end capabilities. Required Skills: Hands-on experience with Cisco FTD firewalls, Cisco ASR / ISR routers and Cisco Catalyst / Nexus switches. Extensive technical experience in implementing enterprise datacenter route / switch designs, i.e., OSPF, BGP, EIGRP, Vlans, etc... Experience with TCP/IP, VoIP, LAN/WAN and Wireless networks. Experience with design and architecture of cloud (AWS, Azure, etc.) infrastructure environments. Experience with Cisco Meraki and Cisco voice gateways a plus. Experience with Cisco VPN technologies, IPSEC, AnyConnect and DMVPN. Experience: Bachelor Degree or equivalent in Computer Science/Engineering or other Networking technologies preferred. Over 8 years of experience with planning, designing, implementing, and testing data communication networks both on-premise and in cloud - Azure / AWS is preferred. 8+ years of experience with Routing, Switching, Firewall, and WiFi operations. CCNP certification or higher preferred. Experience with spearheading engineering efforts or improvements across multiple teams. Experience providing vision, direction, and expertise to leadership on implementing effective business solutions. Experience scripting or coding with one or more languages related to Network Automation. Security protocols and design...AAA, Radius, SSL, IPSEC. Demonstrated skills in documentation applications i.e., MS Excel, MS Visio, Adobe Acrobat Pro, etc... Knowledge Requirements: Understanding of network security design concepts and working knowledge of firewall technologies. Understanding of other network design concepts i.e., Wireless, Load Balancing, etc... Understanding of SAN / NAS, Fiber Channel, and iSCSI designs and implementation ( EMC Unity preferred ). Understanding of VMware / vSphere virtual infrastructure. Understanding of Cisco Unified Computing System. Understanding of network monitoring platforms - Solarwinds experience is preferred.
